text.line_1: Your trade has been canceled on Steam. If you didn't initiate the cancellation, then your account has been compromised. To prevent this problem, do not accept the trade now and follow the steps below:
text.line_2: Change your password in your Steam account settings.
text.line_3: Revoke the API Key generated by the attackers. You can do this using the link. You don't need to generate a new key.
text.line_4: Change your Trade URL. You can do this here.
text.line_5: In the future, be careful when authorizing on third-party sites using your Steam account. They are often the culprit when your account is hacked. You can always find the login history for your Steam account here.
text.line_6: Now your account is safe, and you can continue to use our site.

sidebar.trade_lock_text:
A trade offer for skins with a "Trade Lock" will be sent after they are unlocked and you will have 5 hours to accept the trade.
You can track the date and time when the skin will be unlocked in the Transactions section of your Profile by clicking on the purchased item.

If you do not accept the trade within the specified time, the trade will be canceled and the money will be refunded to your balance.
sidebar.p2p_text: You'll have 12 hours to accept the trade after seller sends it. Failure to accept the trade will result in a 2% fine.
sidebar.success_description: Skins were successfully purchased. You can find them in the Transactions section of your Profile.
